sentence.Network_en: A long drum roll introduced the trapeze artists.
sentence.Network_cn: 长长的一阵紧锣密鼓声中迎来了高空秋千表演者。

sentence.Network_en: By the time he was nine years old, he was already performing as a trapeze artist.
sentence.Network_cn: 他年仅九岁时，便已经在表演空中飞人的特技。

sentence.Network_en: He was a great trapeze artist, but he was completely vain.
sentence.Network_cn: 他秋千确实荡的好, 但他太自负了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from French trapèze, from late Latin trapezium (see trapezium)

entry.tran: (马戏团的)高空秋千，空中吊杠
entry.def: A trapeze is a bar of wood or metal hanging from two ropes on which people in a circus swing and perform skilful movements.

means.word_mean: 1. a swing used by circus acrobats

auth_sentence.content: It wants to dazzle and amaze with flying trapeze artists, high-wire walkers and one-handed handstands.
